subject: Vam pro haptics broken
description_text:
Hello you guys had  helped me by remoting into my pc and getting my haptics
to work right again. They were having a issue where in games the throttle
would just get stuck on and not shut off without unplugging the controller
box. Well that problem has came back. I even added the ground wire from the
pedals to the box. And bare metal contact from the box to the pedal plate.
But the haptics are messing up. The pedals still work just like normal but
the haptics are not. Please help.

conversations.body_text: Hi Dalton Uhl,     You can first try testing with this solution as a reference.        If this happens, it indicates that the computer’s grounding is not reliable, possibly because a three-prong plug was not used with a three-prong wall outlet. You can refer to the post below: connect the computer case to the stand, and connect the control box to the metal screws on the pedals. This should resolve the disconnection issue.  https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding

Ive been through all of this. Your team remoted into my pc last time about
2 to 3 weeks ago and they were working again for a bit. Ive added the
grounding wire from the pedals to the control box. Ive sanded everything so
it had a bare metal contact. Amd it still doesnt work.

I noticed that when it the throttle haptic gets stuck on, usually the
simsonn manager program has frozen itself when the throttle pedal is
pressed in so it thinks the pedal is pressed in when its not, and the only
way to solve it is unplug the control box and use task manager to close
simsonn manager and the program gets frozen but nothing else on pc is
frozen

In the video the white cable goes from the control box to the pc as well.
